data.title: Major League debuts as Minnesota Twins
data.meta_description: Major League debuts as Minnesota Twins provides a list of players that made their MLB debut wearing the colors of the Minnesota Twins.
data.text:
Since the Minnesota Twins started play in 1961 through the 2020 season there have been 874 baseball players (422 position and 452 pitchers) that have worn a Minnesota Twins uniform at one time or another and I am pretty sure all of them can remember their major league debut. But how many of these players made their major league debuts as Minnesota Twins wearing the Twins colors? This list will give you that answer and will tell you when their major league debut took place and how they came to be Minnesota Twins in the first place.

The following players made their major league debuts as Minnesota Twins

2023

Kody Funderburk – (P) – August 28, 2023 – Drafted by the Minnesota Twins in the 15th round of the 2018 MLB June Amateur Draft from Dallas Baptist University (Dallas, TX).

Jordan Balzovic – (P) – June 18, 2023 – Drafted by the Minnesota Twins in the 5th round of the 2016 MLB June Amateur Draft from St. Martin SS (Mississauga, ON) Ca.

Brent Headrick – (P) – April, 19, 2023 – Drafted by the Minnesota Twins in the 9th round of the 2019 MLB June Amateur Draft from Illinois State University (Normal, IL).

Edouard Julien – (2B) – April 12, 2023 – Drafted by the Minnesota Twins in the 18th round of the 2019 MLB June Amateur Draft from Auburn University (Auburn, AL).

2022

Simeon Woods Richardson – (P) – October 2, 2022 – Traded by the Toronto Blue Jays with Austin Martin (minors) to the Minnesota Twins for José Berríos.

435 – Ronny Henriquez – (P) – September 19, 2022 – Was acquired along with shortstop Isiah Kiner-Falefa from the Texas Rangers for catcher Mitch Garver.

Matt Wallner – (OF) – September 17, 2022 – Was drafted by the Minnesota Twins in the 1st round (39th) of the 2019 MLB June Amateur Draft from University of Southern Mississippi (Hattiesburg, MS).

Louie Varland – (P) – September 7, 2022 – Drafted by the Minnesota Twins in the 15th round of the 2019 MLB June Amateur Draft from Concordia University (St. Paul, MN).

Caleb Hamilton – (C) – July 17, 2022 – Drafted by the Minnesota Twins in the 23rd round of the 2016 MLB June Amateur Draft from Oregon State University (Corvallis, OR)

Jermaine Palacious – (SS) – May 31, 2022 – Signed as a Free Agent with the Minnesota Twins in 2013.

Mark Contreras – (OF) – May 11, 2022 – Drafted by the Minnesota Twins in the 9th round of the 2017 MLB June Amateur Draft from University of California, Riverside (Riverside, CA).

Yennier Cano – (P) – May 11, 2022 – Signed as a Free Agent with the Minnesota Twins in 2019.

Royce Lewis – (SS) – May 6, 2022 – Drafted by the Minnesota Twins in the 1st round (1st) of the 2017 MLB June Amateur Draft from JSerra Catholic HS (San Juan Capistrano, CA).

Jose Miranda – (3B) – May 2, 2022 – Drafted by the Minnesota Twins in the 2nd round of the 2016 MLB June Amateur Draft from Leadership Christian Academy (Guaynabo, Puerto Rico).

Cole Sands – (P) – May 1, 2022 – Drafted by the Minnesota Twins in the 5th round of the 2018 MLB June Amateur Draft from Florida State University (Tallahassee, FL).

Josh Winder – (P) – April 12, 2022 – Drafted by the Minnesota Twins in the 7th round of the 2018 MLB June Amateur Draft from Virginia Military Institute (Lexington, VA).

Jhoan Duran – (P) – April 8, 2022 – Traded by the Arizona Diamondbacks with Ernie De La Trinidad (minors) and Gabriel Maciel (minors) to the Minnesota Twins for Eduardo Escobar.

2021

Jovani Moran – (P) – September 12, 2021 – Drafted by the Minnesota Twins in the 7th round of the 2015 MLB June Amateur Draft from Carlos Beltran Baseball Academy (Florida, Puerto Rico).

Joe Ryan – (P) – September 1, 2021 – The Minnesota Twins traded Nelson Cruz with Calvin Faucher (minors) to the Tampa Bay Rays for Joe Ryan (minors) and Drew Strotman (minors).

Charlie Barnes – (P) – July 17, 2021 – Drafted by the Minnesota Twins in the 4th round of the 2017 MLB June Amateur Draft from Clemson University (Clemson, SC).

Gilberto Celestino – (OF) – June 2, 2021 – Traded by the Houston Astros along with Jorge Alcala to the Minnesota Twins for Ryan Pressly on July 27, 2018.

Bailey Ober – (P) – May 18, 2021 – Drafted by the Minnesota Twins in the 12th round of the 2017 MLB June Amateur Draft from College of Charleston (Charleston, SC).

Trevor Larnach – (OF) – May 8, 2021 – Drafted by the Minnesota Twins in the 1st round (20th) of the 2018 MLB June Amateur Draft from Oregon State University (Corvallis, OR).

2020

Travis Blankenhorn – (2B) – September 15, 2020 – Drafted by the Minnesota Twins in the 3rd round of the 2015 MLB June Amateur Draft.

Aaron Whitefield– (OF) – July 25, 2020 – Signed as an amateur free agent on May 19, 2015.

2019

Bert Cueto (P) – July 26, 1961 – Signed as an amateur free agent in 1956. Cueto is the first Twins player to make his major league debut as a Minnesota Twin at Met Stadium.

Rich Rollins (3B) – June 16, 1961 – Signed as amateur free agent in 1960

Gerry Arrigo (P) – June 12, 1961 – drafted from White Sox in 1960 first year draft

Fred Bruckbauer (P) – April 25, 1961 – Signed as amateur free agent in 1959. Fred Bruckbauer is the first native Minnesotan to make his MLB debut in a Minnesota Twins uniform.

Bill Pleis (P) – April 16, 1961 – Traded by Orlando (Florida State) to the Washington Senators for $250 plus 2 players in 1956

Lee Stange (P) – April 15, 1961 (bottom of the eighth inning) – Signed as amateur free agent in 1957. The second player and first pitcher to make his major league debut in a Minnesota Twins uniform was RHP Lee Stange when he entered the April 15, 1961 game in the eighth inning at Memorial Stadium against the Baltimore Orioles and pitched the final inning of the game for Minnesota.

1.Ron Henry (C) – April 15, 1961 (top of the fifth inning) – 1960 Rule 5 draft from Milwaukee Braves. Catcher Ron Henry was the first player to make his major league debut in a Minnesota Twins uniform when he entered the April 15, 1961 game in the fifth inning at Memorial Stadium against the Baltimore Orioles as a pinch-hitter.
